body:
Comment 2: 
Go windows executables do not have separate BSS section. Uninitialized variables live in
.data section together with other data.

$ objdump -h bar

bar:     file format pei-i386

Sections:
Idx Name          Size      VMA       LMA       File off  Algn
  0 .text         00045490  00401000  00401000  00000400  2**2
                  CONTENTS, ALLOC, LOAD, READONLY, CODE, DATA
  1 .data         0000a400  00447000  00447000  00045a00  2**2
                  CONTENTS, ALLOC, LOAD, DATA
  2 .debug_abbrev 000000cc  00862000  00862000  0004fe00  2**0
                  CONTENTS, READONLY, DEBUGGING
  3 .debug_line   00005e76  00863000  00863000  00050000  2**0
                  CONTENTS, READONLY, DEBUGGING
  4 .debug_frame  00003720  00869000  00869000  00056000  2**0
                  CONTENTS, READONLY, DEBUGGING
  5 .debug_info   00012cd4  0086d000  0086d000  00059800  2**0
                  CONTENTS, READONLY, DEBUGGING
  6 .debug_pubnames 00007862  00880000  00880000  0006c600  2**0
                  CONTENTS, READONLY, DEBUGGING
  7 .debug_pubtypes 00001217  00888000  00888000  00074000  2**0
                  CONTENTS, READONLY, DEBUGGING
  8 .debug_aranges 00000508  0088a000  0088a000  00075400  2**0
                  CONTENTS, READONLY, DEBUGGING
  9 .debug_gdb_scripts 0000002c  0088b000  0088b000  00075a00  2**0
                  CONTENTS, READONLY, DEBUGGING
 10 .idata        0000034e  0088c000  0088c000  00075c00  2**2
                  CONTENTS, ALLOC, LOAD, DATA
 11 .edata        0000006e  0088d000  0088d000  00076000  2**2
                  CONTENTS, ALLOC, LOAD, READONLY, DATA
 12 .symtab       000000c1  0088e000  0088e000  00076200  2**2
                  CONTENTS, READONLY

Unfortunately, I do not know enough about gcc and its object files to be able to help
you. Perhaps, Wei knows more and will be willing to help. You could try and fix it
yourself - i am happy to help you. If nothing else, I will look into it eventually.

Alex

PS: You cannot use GNU nm program to display Go symbols on windows
(https://golang.org/issue/2199). Use go 6nm program instead:

$ 6nm bar
  4087d2 t BestFit
  446460 D LocalAlloc
  446468 D LocalFree
  40525d t MCentral_Alloc
  40533e t MCentral_Free
  4054ce t MCentral_Grow
  408790 t MHeap_AllocLarge
  40851d t MHeap_AllocLocked
  408b18 t MHeap_FreeLocked
  40883d t MHeap_Grow
  ...
_Labels changed: added **cgo**, **os-windows**._ _Owner changed to @alexbrainman._ _Status changed to **Accepted**._
